summary: Email chain between a DOJ Attaché at the U.S. Embassy in Paris and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, discussing coordination with the Paris prosecutor's office regarding their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's potential connections to France. The emails cover scheduling calls, confidentiality concerns, and the timing of French search warrants.

persons.name: Kiersten Fletcher
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor handling the Epstein investigation, coordinating with the DOJ Attaché in Paris about sharing information with French authorities.

persons.name: Jonathan Rebold
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor on the Epstein investigation team, mentioned as a point of contact for the Paris inquiry.

persons.name: Sasha-Anais Sharif
persons.context: DOJ official at the U.S. Embassy in Paris acting as liaison, communicating updates from the Paris prosecutor's office to SDNY prosecutors and facilitating coordination.

connections.description: Communicating and scheduling calls to discuss sharing information between U.S. and French investigations into Epstein.
Sharif reaches out to Rebold as part of the SDNY Epstein investigation team regarding the Paris prosecutor's inquiry.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys on the SDNY team handling the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators.

events.title: Call scheduled between SDNY and DOJ Attaché
events.description: Scheduled a call for 9:30 AM Eastern to discuss coordination with the Paris prosecutor's office regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Follow-up call with Paris prosecutor's office
events.description: DOJ Attaché Sharif had a follow-up call with the Paris prosecutor's office about their Epstein investigation, discussing confidentiality and upcoming search warrants.

events.title: Call scheduled with Paris prosecutor's office on confidentiality
events.description: Sharif scheduled a call with the Paris prosecutor's office to discuss the confidentiality of any information shared by the U.S.

events.title: Initial inquiry about Paris prosecutor's office request
events.description: Sharif reached out to SDNY prosecutors Fletcher and Rebold regarding an inquiry from the Paris prosecutor's office about Epstein's potential connections to France.

keyFacts: The Paris prosecutor's office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential connections to France as of September 2019.
The Paris prosecutor's office was preparing to execute search warrants, possibly as early as the week of September 9, 2019.

French authorities assured that shared information would remain confidential until a criminal defendant is placed under examination, at which point the defendant would gain access to the investigative file.
The U.S. SDNY prosecution team and the DOJ Attaché in Paris were coordinating to determine what information could be shared with French investigators.
The email chain shows direct, post-arrest international coordination between U.S. and French law enforcement regarding the Epstein case.
